intro: Stephania tomentosa, commonly known as the veiny arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive veining pattern. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by bright red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
